intro: Placea davidii, commonly known as David's placea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Placea davidii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
